definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: Our packing is in Chinese national style , and suitable for display in super-market.
sentences.chinese: 我們的包裝具有中國民族風格，適於在超級市場陳列。

sentences.english: Visitors are requested not to touch the exhibits.
The lastest winter fashions are now on view in the big shops.
sentences.chinese: 最新的冬裝款式現在正在大商店中陳列着。

sentences.english: Now their skeleton forever has kept on museum Chen Liejia.
sentences.chinese: 現在它們的骨架永遠地留在了博物館的陳列架上。

sentences.english: Let me take it out of the showcase.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我把它從陳列櫃裏拿出來，給您。

sentences.english: They have good exhibits and fascinating displays.
sentences.chinese: 它們有許多優良的陳列品和吸引人的展品。

sentences.english: No, I have to set up a display for the computer exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我得替電腦展做好陳列。

sentences.english: All product price and information is subject to in store display.
sentences.chinese: 所有貨品價格及資料以店內陳列爲準。

sentences.english: His mother's ashes are in a white box on the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他母親的骨灰就在這個陳列櫥中的白盒中。

sentences.english: AdMob puts display ads on mobile web pages and inside mobile applications.
sentences.chinese: AdMob在手機網頁和手機軟件裏放置陳列式廣告。

sentences.english: This is the African art that is displayed in art museums .
sentences.chinese: 這一類別就是在博物館中陳列的非洲藝術。

sentences.english: This post showcases the most unusual and creative advertising campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 這篇帖子陳列了最與衆不同和有創意的廣告宣傳。

sentences.english: The exhibits were arranged according to schools.
sentences.chinese: 展品是依照流派陳列的。

sentences.english: Highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets;
sentences.chinese: 擦得發亮的銀器陳列在明亮的玻璃櫃裏。

sentences.english: The Australian collections in the exhibition room include Maori costume and ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 本陳列室澳洲收藏品包含毛利族服裝與飾品。

sentences.english: Some Chinese made timepieces are also on display.
sentences.chinese: 也陳列着一些中國的老時鐘。

definition: to set up/to arrange/to lay out
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
space/room/(fig.) scope/leeway/(astronomy) outer space/(physics, math.) space
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
